review_title: Toxic management, organisation is trying to budget cut its way to profitability
pros: If you like being squeezed financially by your employer and still be asked to work above and beyond your scope of practice, this is the place for you.
cons: Pay and benefits are not competitive for the Bozeman area. Organisation is chronically understaffed and yet there are so many middle managers and HR personel who don’t seem to do much and have aweful communication skills. Managers are almost always in meetings and seem unable to take feedback from the staff and providers they depend on run the business

pros: Specializes in psychological torture to induce learned helplessness. Every year new clinicians are regularly tortured till they are forced to resign, or get themselves physically and emotionally sick. Heavily dependent on non-doctors to provide bogus reviews on the clinicians. Fear and backstabbing trickles from the top down; because of desire to please those above, admins regularly try to frame clinicans. Bipolar personalities are rampant among the admins that form fixed, immutable views, and engage in favoritism.
cons: Fresh new graduates with zero experience and mediocre background are regularly appointed to top leadership positions so admins can do whatever they want. Favoritism is the name of the game here, so if you manage to get on the good side, you will be able to get away fine with anything.

review_title: Excellent Place to work, great benefits, awesome pay, great coworkers!
job_title: Mental Health Worker in Billings, MT
pros: Excellent place to work, the environment overall is comfortable but professional. The benefits package is awesome, management cares about how the staff are doing and is willing to help staff in any way possible. The pay is amazing for the area, adjustments are made when review surveys suggest a pay increase is needed to remain competitive. Coworkers are awesome! Much of the staff is cross trained so if you're in a someone to help is always near!
cons: For some staff like mental health workers and other support staff opportunities for advancement simply do not exist. Further training (unless you're a Nurse) is necessary to advance in some areas.

pros: Its a stable organization where you can work your way up through varies positions and improve yourself.  For example, I started in medical records and moved into pharmacy, from there I have recieved encouragement to pursue a degree in pharmacy.  Billings clinic does encourage its employees to improve themselves.
cons: Right now they are really expanding too fast which is cutting the budget for the established departments right now.  Its a sad day when you cant afford you office chairs or sticky notes but two new buildings are going up.  However since it is the largest employer in the area the level or red tape can get kind of silly.

pros: Billings Clinic offers excellent job opportunities and is an all around supportive company.  The many programs they offer to employees such as tuition assistance, private counseling, and employee discount to multiple companies across Billings proves that this company cares.  Billings Clinic is an innovative company and a leader in this nation's healthcare industry.
cons: You have to use your own PTO for sick time but they don't allot you any PTO right off the bat to compensate for this so it can be hard to build up PTO if you (or your kids) are a typical person that comes down with the common cold every year.

review_title: Objectively decent enough, subjectively best hospital in area
pros: Wonderful sense of community here with lots of employee resources and family-friendly activities outside of work. The doctors are great but the nurses are pretty clueless, so I have no idea how quality happens yet somehow it appears to?
cons: Parking and the low-quality yet outrageously-priced food in their cafe and cafeteria are both utterly terrible. We have over 120 employees in my department alone (the main hospital lab) and only 48 parking spots within a 5-minute walk of the building. The hospital next door to us has a huge parking garage structure, yet somehow despite decades of employee requests, the management still won't build one for us here. It's very frustrating to finish a 14-hour shift at 6am only to find my car has received a ticket from hospital security for taking up a patient-only space in an empty lot for a department that closed before my shift even started. Thoroughly ridiculous.

pros: The people there are good people. The pay is pretty good but low for the industry. The other departments are filled with great people that I loved to work with.
cons: Over worked and underpaid.  When I first started there it was a great place to work but within a couple years they overloaded the entire IT group with many more users and areas of coverage but reduced the size of the group. We went from barely keeping our heads above water to drowning and getting yelled at for it.

pros: Emphasis on making each interaction with clients and coworkers pleasant. High quality Healthcare service for a large rural area of the country.
cons: The usual corporate policies that are made to retain good employees sometimes backfire and retain horrible employees with little work ethic all while driving out the people who really do a great job.

pros: Encourages continued education. Dedicated healthcare staff, coworkers are very dedicated to providing excellent health care to our patients,
cons: Management is becoming more concerned with the bottom line and less about the staff that makes the clinic what it is, Lower than average wages.

review_title: Good pay, culture of protecting upper management
job_title: In Supply Chain Management in Billings, MT
pros: The pay was competitive with other businesses in town.  The raises were minimal, but I started decently high.  I had a supervisor who respected my work ethic and was flexible with my school and work schedule.
cons: I felt that HR was very protective of upper management and no one likes to rock the boat when it comes to filing legitimate complaints.

pros: well because the management was really good to me and other employees. There was work with me if I had an emergency of any kind. Management was awesome I loved working for Sodexo.
cons: downsides were probably having to get up at 3:30 in the morning and be in work at four but other than that  I was happy there like working with Sodexo

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Billings, MT
pros: Nursing staff are exceptional.  The opportunities to learn and grow if you are seeking a health career are excellent here.  There are excellent opportunities for additional training if you desire them.
cons: Favoritism plays a huge part within the inner circle of management.  There is poor consideration among some department managers for pre-existing staff commitments to schedules, personal events, etc., and employees on some floors are expected to take change even if it means loss of financial investment or pre-planned time.

pros: Good Doctors, Great care if you are a patient
cons: Serious "that's not my job" culture, poor performers and problem employees are not disciplined, always a budget crisis even though the hospital is making money, my timecard was frequently incorrect even though we had an electronic system, when I resigned I did not receive my vacation buyout on my last check

pros: Billings Clinic ICU has hands down the best team of nurses and doctors you will work with. It’s a stressful job by nature and the team of nurses and doctors on this unit make coming to work a thousand times easier.
cons: It’s an ICU, the patients are sick, it can be stressful. Given Billings Clinic accepts patients from such a large area, you see a lot.

pros: Great colleagues to work with, doctor and nurses get along well, low physician turnover in the hospitalist department. Great place to live for families.
cons: There isn't a lot of physicians in the management of the hospital, so doctor's voices do not often get heard. Very little upward mobility in the hospital.  Little monetary and administrative support of the hospitalist department.

pros: Good benefits; EMR accessible across all specialities
